snippet: The developments dampened hopes of the insurgents opposed to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria that they could quickly subdue or co-opt the group.
abstract: Extremist militant group the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria has retaken significant parts of the territory in northern Syria that rival insurgent groups had wrested away, making good on threats to contest attacks by former allies on its power and claimed turf.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The developments dampened hopes of the insurgents opposed to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria that they could quickly subdue or co-opt the group.

headline.main: Extremist Militant Group in Syria Retakes Ground Lost to Rival Rebels
headline.print_headline: Extremist Militant Group in Syria Retakes Ground Lost to Rival Rebels
